message: I don't know if something changed, or I'm just getting old, but I find it really hard to read the directory listings on github now.  The grey and light blue text is too close in color to the background color.  I guess I can greasemonkey it, but does anyone have this issue?
Betting your'e on Linux with Microsoft fonts installed? (Courier New in particular)
Actually, I'm using the Droid fonts
btw.  It looks fine now, not sure if something changed.
So if you do color:#000; it renders at #777
I'd be willing to bet a lot of money that you had MS Fonts installed that were overrriding Courier New with a font that isn't courier new and renders text at half the color value you tell it
Because Linux and Microsoft are both tart and can't render text
greasemonkey is old news, do it dotjs style!
@kneath you were right.  I got back home and it was the family PC with the trouble.  I uninstalled ms fonts and it looks great now.
@locks Thanks.  Now I can have msfonts and read github: https://github.com/dokipen/dokipen-dotjs/blob/master/github.com.js
